title: Talks Set To Resume On Iran's Nuclear Program
teaser: The deadline is approaching on a framework for the deal that the West hopes will prevent Iran from developing a nuclear weapon.
contentencoded:
There’s an end of the month deadline on a framework for the comprehensive agreement the West hopes will prevent Iran from developing a nuclear weapon. But so far negotiators can’t even reach consensus on that framework. With the talks about to resume in Switzerland, Here & Now’s Robin Young checks in with NPR’s Peter Kenyon, who will be there for the talks tomorrow.

Guest

  • Peter Kenyon, international correspondent for NPR, based in Istanbul, Turkey.Â He tweets @pkenyonnpr.
